comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Wonderful - yet ANOTHER panorama of Newcastle. There are many, and I get completely muddled trying to sort out which, why, and when! See this blog re other Newcastle panos - coalriver.wordpress.com/?s=panorama&submit=Search . And this work-in-progress on Flickr - www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/5763060299/ But this is an original glass negative so is hugely important (!). Are there other frames to the left and right apart from the image next door? Good of John Bingle (RIP) to set the earliest date as 1882 (I cannot read it). My initial guess from all the sailing coal ships is c.1890 ? More Newcastle panos at www.flickr.com/search/?w=8571926@N06&q=newcastle%20pa...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Great blog - we have earmarked it for further viewing. I think you are in the right time for the ships and the number of buildings on the waterfront. I didn't realise there were so many pics of Newcastle Harbour on Flickr! Great resource :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Oh and this (and the next pic along) were the only two I could find the William Hall Collection so far - but will keep digging!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
This 4-frame pano is taken from very nearby in the graveyard in the "1880s".  It looks as if there is at least one frame missing between the photo and the next.  Very interesting!
